summary: Research suggests that in countries where women participate in the labor force, economies enjoy greater growth than in similar countries where participation is restricted. U.S. trade preference programs aim to foster growth in about 130 developing countries. However, women may face disproportional challenges participating in them. We reviewed the 4 U.S. trade preference programs and found that they do not specifically protect or promote women's...
title: International Trade: Observations On Whether Women's Rights and Economic Interests Are Protected or Promoted by U.S. Trade Preference Programs
